00022     class API Ham {
00023     private:
00024         std::vector<uint> _H, _hp, _hv, _x;
00025 
00026     public:
00027         bool operator!=(const Ham &other) const { return true; }
00028 
00029         Ham begin() const { return *this; }
00030 
00031         Ham end() const { return *this; }
00032 
00033         uint operator*() const { return _x.back(); }
00034 
00035         Ham(const std::vector<uint> &pfs)
00036             : _H(pfs), _hp(pfs.size(), 0), _hv(pfs), _x(1, 1) {}
00037 
00038         const Ham &operator++()
00039         {
00040             for (uint i = 0; i < _H.size(); i++)
00041                 for (; _hv[i] <= _x.back(); _hv[i] = _x[++_hp[i]] * _H[i])
00042                     ;
00043             _x.push_back(_hv[0]);
00044             for (uint i = 1; i < _H.size(); i++)
00045                 if (_hv[i] < _x.back())
00046                     _x.back() = _hv[i];
00047             return *this;
00048         }
00049     };
00050 
00051     static inline uint next_regular(uint target)
00052     {
00053 
00054         for (auto i : Ham({2, 3, 5})) {
00055             if (i > target)
00056                 return i;
00057         }
00058         return 0;
00059     }

00068     // linear convolution function
00069     static inline void convolution(const ftype *__restrict signal,
00070                                    const int SignalLen,
00071                                    const ftype *__restrict kernel,
00072                                    const int KernelLen, ftype *__restrict res)
00073     {
00074         const int size = KernelLen + SignalLen - 1;
00075 
00076         #pragma omp parallel for
00077         for (auto n = 0; n < size; ++n) {
00078             res[n] = 0;
00079             const uint kmin = (n >= KernelLen - 1) ? n - (KernelLen - 1) : 0;
00080             const uint kmax = (n < SignalLen - 1) ? n : SignalLen - 1;
00081             // uint j = n - kmin;
00082             for (uint k = kmin; k <= kmax; k++) {
00083                 res[n] += signal[k] * kernel[n - k];
00084                 //--j;
00085             }
00086         }
00087     }

00089     static inline void convolution_with_ffts(f_vector_t signal,
00090             f_vector_t kernel,
00091             f_vector_t &res)
00092     {
00093         complex_vector_t v1; //(signal.size());
00094         complex_vector_t v2; //(kernel.size());
00095         const uint size = signal.size() + kernel.size() - 1;
00096         res.resize(size);
00097 
00098         fft::rfft(signal, v1, size, omp_get_max_threads());
00099         fft::rfft(kernel, v2, size, omp_get_max_threads());
00100 
00101         std::transform(v1.begin(), v1.end(), v2.begin(), v1.begin(),
00102                        std::multiplies<complex_t>());
00103 
00104         fft::irfft(v1, res, size, omp_get_max_threads());
00105     }

00107     // Parameters are like python's np.interp
00108     // @x: x-coordinates of the interpolated values
00109     // @xp: The x-coords of the data points
00110     // @fp: the y-coords of the data points
00111     // @y: the interpolated values, same shape as x
00112     // @left: value to return for x < xp[0]
00113     // @right: value to return for x > xp[last]
00114     static inline void lin_interp(const std::vector<ftype> &x,
00115                                   const std::vector<ftype> &xp,
00116                                   const std::vector<ftype> &yp,
00117                                   std::vector<ftype> &y,
00118                                   const ftype left,
00119                                   const ftype right)
00120     {
00121         // assert(y.empty());
00122         assert(xp.size() == yp.size());
00123         // const ftype left = yp.front();
00124         // const ftype right = yp.back();
00125         y.resize(x.size());
00126 
00127         const int N = x.size();
00128         // const uint M = xp.size();
00129         const auto max = xp.back();
00130         const auto min = xp.front();
00131         const auto end = xp.end();
00132         const auto begin = xp.begin();
00133 
00134         int k = 0;
00135         while (x[k] < min && k < N) {
00136             y[k] = left;
00137             ++k;
00138         }
00139 
00140         auto j = begin;
00141 
00142         for (int i = k; i < N; ++i) {
00143             if (x[i] > max) {
00144                 y[i] = right;
00145                 continue;
00146             }
00147             j = std::lower_bound(j, end, x[i]);
00148             const auto pos = j - begin;
00149             if (*j == x[i]) {
00150                 y[i] = yp[pos];
00151             } else {
00152                 y[i] = yp[pos - 1] +
00153                        (yp[pos] - yp[pos - 1]) * (x[i] - xp[pos - 1]) /
00154                        (xp[pos] - xp[pos - 1]);
00155             }
00156         }
00157     }

00159     // Function to implement integration of f(x) over the interval
00160     // [a,b] using the trapezoid rule with nsub subdivisions.
00161     template <typename T>
00162     static inline f_vector_t cum_trapezoid(const T *f,
00163                                            const T deltaX,
00164                                            const int nsub)
00165     {
00166         // initialize the partial sum to be f(a)+f(b) and
00167         // deltaX to be the step size using nsub subdivisions
00168         // ftype *psum = new ftype[nsub];
00169         f_vector_t psum(nsub - 1);
00170         // psum[0] = 0;
00171         const auto half_dx = deltaX / 2.0;
00172         psum[0] = (f[1] + f[0]) * half_dx;
00173         // increment the partial sum
00174         // #pragma omp parallel for
00175         for (int i = 1; i < nsub - 1; ++i)
00176             psum[i] = psum[i - 1] + (f[i + 1] + f[i]) * half_dx;
00177 
00178         return psum;
00179     }
00180 
00181     // Function to implement integration of f(x) over the interval
00182     // [a,b] using the trapezoid rule with nsub subdivisions.
00183     template <typename T>
00184     static inline f_vector_t cum_trapezoid(const T *f,
00185                                            const T deltaX,
00186                                            const T initial,
00187                                            const int nsub)
00188     {
00189         // initialize the partial sum to be f(a)+f(b) and
00190         // deltaX to be the step size using nsub subdivisions
00191         // ftype *psum = new ftype[nsub];
00192         f_vector_t psum(nsub);
00193         const auto half_dx = deltaX / 2.0;
00194 
00195         psum[0] = initial;
00196         psum[1] = (f[1] + f[0]) * half_dx;
00197         // increment the partial sum
00198         for (int i = 2; i < nsub; ++i)
00199             psum[i] = psum[i - 1] + (f[i] + f[i - 1]) * half_dx;
00200 
00201         return psum;
00202     }
00203 
00204     template <typename T>
00205     static inline ftype trapezoid(T *f, const ftype *deltaX, const int nsub)
00206     {
00207         // initialize the partial sum to be f(a)+f(b) and
00208         // deltaX to be the step size using nsub subdivisions
00209 
00210         ftype psum = 0.0;
00211 // increment the partial sum
00212         #pragma omp parallel for reduction(+ : psum)
00213         for (int i = 1; i < nsub; ++i) {
00214             psum += (f[i] + f[i - 1]) * (deltaX[i] - deltaX[i - 1]);
00215         }
00216 
00217         // return approximation
00218         return psum / 2;
00219     }
00220 
00221     template <typename T>
00222     static inline ftype trapezoid(T *f, const ftype deltaX, const int nsub)
00223     {
00224         // initialize the partial sum to be f(a)+f(b) and
00225         // deltaX to be the step size using nsub subdivisions
00226         ftype psum = f[0] + f[nsub - 1]; // f(a)+f(b);
00227 // ftype deltaX = (b-a)/nsub;
00228 
00229 // increment the partial sum
00230         #pragma omp parallel for reduction(+ : psum)
00231         for (int i = 1; i < nsub - 1; ++i) {
00232             psum += 2 * f[i];
00233         }
00234 
00235         // multiply the sum by the constant deltaX/2.0
00236         psum = (deltaX / 2) * psum;
00237 
00238         // return approximation
00239         return psum;
00240     }

00242     template <typename T>
00243     static inline uint min(T *a, uint size, uint step = 1)
00244     {
00245         uint p = 0;
00246         T min = a[0];
00247         //#pragma omp parallel for  shared(p) reduction(min : min)
00248         for (uint i = 1; i < size; i += step) {
00249             if (a[i] < min) {
00250                 min = a[i];
00251                 p = i;
00252             }
00253         }
00254         return p;
00255     }
00256 
00257     template <typename T>
00258     static inline uint max(T *a, uint size, uint step = 1)
00259     {
00260         uint p = 0;
00261         T max = a[0];
00262         //#pragma omp parallel for shared(p) reduction(max : max)
00263         for (uint i = 1; i < size; i += step) {
00264             if (a[i] > max) {
00265                 max = a[i];
00266                 p = i;
00267             }
00268         }
00269         return p;
00270     }

00272     static inline void linspace(ftype *a, const ftype start, const ftype end,
00273                                 const uint n, const uint keep_from = 0)
00274     {
00275         const ftype step = (end - start) / (n - 1);
00276         // ftype value = start;
00277         //#pragma omp parallel for
00278         for (uint i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00279             if (i >= keep_from)
00280                 a[i - keep_from] = start + i * step;
00281             // value += step;
00282         }
00283     }

00285     template <typename T>
00286     static inline std::vector<T> arange(T start, T stop, T step = 1)
00287     {
00288         std::vector<T> values;
00289         for (T value = start; value < stop; value += step)
00290             values.push_back(value);
00291         return values;
00292     }

00294     template <typename T>
00295     static inline ftype mean(const T data[], const int n)
00296     {
00297         ftype m = 0.0;
00298         #pragma omp parallel for reduction(+ : m)
00299         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00300             m += data[i];
00301         }
00302         return m / n;
00303     }
00304 
00305     template <typename T>
00306     static inline ftype standard_deviation(const T data[], const int n,
00307                                            const ftype mean)
00308     {
00309         ftype sum_deviation = 0.0;
00310         #pragma omp parallel for reduction(+ : sum_deviation)
00311         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00312             sum_deviation += (data[i] - mean) * (data[i] - mean);
00313         return std::sqrt(sum_deviation / n);
00314     }
00315 
00316     template <typename T>
00317     static inline ftype standard_deviation(const T data[], const int n)
00318     {
00319         const ftype mean = mymath::mean(data, n);
00320         ftype sum_deviation = 0.0;
00321         #pragma omp parallel for reduction(+ : sum_deviation)
00322         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
00323             sum_deviation += (data[i] - mean) * (data[i] - mean);
00324         return std::sqrt(sum_deviation / n);
00325     }

00327     template <typename T> int sign(T val)
00328     {
00329         return (T(0) < val) - (val < T(0));
00330     }
